description: Grants the user's body the properties of rubber, allowing them to stretch and become immune to blunt attacks and electricity.

users.circumstances: Luffy accidentally ate the fruit as a child

abilityReveals.description: An anime-original technique where Luffy stretches his arms in a net-like formation to capture or punch enemies. The name translates to 'Bug-Catching Net.'
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: Luffy uses this technique to punch Cerberus, the three-headed dog zombie, after it bites him on Thriller Bark.

description: Grants the user the ability to turn themselves and whatever they touch (living or nonliving) invisible, making them a Clear Human.

users.circumstances: Absalom possesses this fruit as a member of Gecko Moria's crew

abilityReveals.description: Absalom uses his invisibility to stealthily attack and restrain targets without being seen. In this episode, he uses it to assault Nami in the bathroom.
abilityReveals.firstUseContext: Absalom turns invisible to attack Nami while she is bathing, demonstrating the predatory applications of his power.

weaknesses.weakness: Can be detected through non-visual means
weaknesses.description: While invisible, Absalom can still be heard and felt, as shown when Nami kicks him and Usopp/Chopper fight back.

strengths.description: Absalom can become completely invisible, making him nearly impossible to track visually.
Absalom can extend his invisibility to objects and people he touches.
